text: hi everyone anthony fantano here
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new moon face
album julia with blue jeans on moon face
is the pseudonym for canadian singer
songwriter and multi-instrumentalist
spencer krug he has been in a number of
different successful bands and projects
over the years like swan lake sunset
rubdown as well as wolf parade his
newest is moon face and it's the most
indulgent and seemingly flexible of his
project so far putting out an ep of
songs based on marimba an album of songs
based around oregon another full-length
album where he actually featured a
full-fledged band that was playing songs
he had written he's been releasing at
least something with every year that
he's been writing music under this name
and his latest here julia with blue
jeans on is another pretty surprising
turn in his moon face based ventures
spencer is not with a band on this
record he's back to doing things solo
and he is on he is behind his main axe
the piano and this lp delivers 10 tracks
that are a little out of the ordinary
for spencer in that they are very
personal and blatant about the fact that
spencer is writing about some
experiences that he's had especially
dealing with
love hey
a lot of the tracks on here are very
clearly love songs however it's not like
spencer explores just simply one side of
love throughout this record this album
has romance and tragedy infatuation
loneliness and there are some moments
here where spencer is just being deeply
introspective
like on spots such as love the house
you're in it feels like he's trying to
deliver these personal experiences
without sugarcoating things over
dramatizing things or building things up
a little too much this philosophic
approach that spencer is taking with the
lyrics on this lp is stated in just a
few lines on the title track here it's a
madman's game making the commonplace
unreal fantasy it's a madman's game at
the very least a young man's game
thank you
thank you thank you and this is really
like a turning point for spencer because
typically his songs lyrically are so odd
and esoteric and extravagant and
eccentric he's not even delivering his
lyrics on a lot of these songs in an
incredibly concise way there's so many
tracks here where it feels like his
lyrics are just rambling they're not
structured that heavily
and this is a direction that i think
spencer pulls off very well some of the
time maybe not so well on other tracks
here i think an example of this working
out is when spencer can pull together a
passionate track a moving track a
riveting track like the title track on
here where there's a lyric that hits me
where he says i think the only word
worth singing is not god it's you and
the track to me is all about finding
beauty it's about finding inspiration in
not only the ordinary but this other
person whom you are in love with
then on the flip side of this
double-edged sword we have the song
dreamy summer which
is one of the longer tracks here and
meanders melodically structurally
vocally lyrically to the point where i
just feel like this song is very very
mundane there's not really much about it
that i like aside from the very refined
piano playing however i i do think
spencer is conscious of that mundaneness
and doesn't care because i think he's
focusing a lot more on just exercising
these emotional demons and kind of
taking the good with the bad on that and
it really is more good than bad a lot of
the time on here like with the opening
track barbarian where i feel like
lyrically spencer is putting his dark
side and putting his more innocent side
on display measuring them up a bit
something that i think he does in an
even more bold and obvious way on
barbarian part two a two minute track a
follow up but in between these two
tracks is maybe my favorite on this
entire lp everyone is noah everyone is
the arc where spencer is taking
relationships and needing other people
whether these relationships be platonic
or romantic or whatever and comparing
this to the story of noah and the ark i
think my favorite line on this entire
track is when he says everyone ends up
talking to the sky or staring the
elephants in the eye another particular
line on here that makes the metaphor
really obvious is when spencer is saying
that everyone gathers souls around
themselves to feel needed and useful and
loved then there is the dark
yet unapologetically cheesy november
a track where spencer is talking about
how he is destroying his own music and
how it wasn't that good anyway
destroying computers and getting
together with his significant other in
this track who he refers to as his
slaughterer and i feel like there are a
group of lines on this track that
display just how crazy spencer and this
girl are and how flawed their
relationship is but there are moments of
great beauty throughout this track too
but then we get hit with the refrain
that's just basically
a repeat over and over and over of baby
we both know that we're both crazy
as far as other tracks on here there's
the very dramatic black is back in style
and the very grand closing track your
chariot maybe not one of the most epic
songs on this lp but as far as the piano
playing on here it is very very again
grand and a beautiful display of
spencer's chops to kind of close this lp
out as far as the sound goes on here
it's a very simple portrayal of voice
and piano the piano sounds like this
very well kept grand piano and the sound
the recording is just pristine and the
singing on this record another change
for spencer in a sense is some of his
most vulnerable yet i feel like you can
call spencer krugel out of things but
you cannot call the man emotionless as
he croons and yelps and moans and shouts
and
through every single track here
typically songs like the ones that are
delivered on this lp where the structure
and the lyricism and the story and just
the point is also
loose it just doesn't turn me on i mean
prime examples the last weekend album
the new nick cave and the bad seeds
album however with spencer's captivating
vocals and potent emotions
and
somewhat
self-deprecating lyrics i think this and
the very sharp piano playing adds up to
some great introspections a lot of
personality and some very enjoyable
songs too i didn't love this thing but i
did like it quite a bit i'm feeling a
light to decent seven on this transition
if you've given this lp a listen what
did you think of it did you love it did
you hate it
why what do you think i should review
next and that's it anthony fantano moon
face
forever
